questionListItems.title: Can I join ACS (Primary) as a parent volunteer to be eligible for Phase 2B of P1 Registration?

answer.body: From past years’ registration pattern, there are always more applicants than places available at Phase 2B in ACS (Primary). This is the phase where Methodist Church members and active community leaders are registering. Thus, many were balloted out at this phase of registration. As it is not good to have parents who serve the school for 40 hours and having to go through the balloting process, the school has decided not to have parent volunteers before the child is admitted to the school.

questionListItems.title: What are the chances of transferring my child to ACS (Primary) and how can I do so?

answer.body: Parents can apply for the child to be put in the wait list found at this link. As movement of student is very minimal, vacancies are hard to come by. School will keep the wait list for the following year if parents are not contacted and there is no necessity to re-submit the application yearly. If there is any update on the child’s record, parents can email the school.

questionListItems.title: What is the timeline and the different phases of the P1 Registration Exercise?

answer.body: Please refer to the MOE P1 registration website at https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/registration-phases-key-dates for details on the registration phases and key dates.

questionListItems.title: How do I find out on the vacancy situation and balloting information during P1 Registration Exercise?

answer.body: Information on the number of available vacancies and applicants for relevant phases of the P1 registration will be made available on the MOE P1 website at https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/vacancies-and-balloting. This information will be updated at the end of each registration day, except for the last day of registration. However, such statistics should not be taken as final during the exercise due to its dynamic nature as parents can withdraw and make changes throughout the registration period.
